text: Looking for breakfast or lunch? Eat here. Cafe food with a Yoli twist.

While the food was good (but not remarkable), the service was really poor. We arrived around 10 on a Tuesday...waited 15 minutes for a table (no big deal) then another 25 for someone to take our order, then another 30 to get our food.  It was fine for breakfast, but I hadn't planned to spend over an hour before I ate. Also, we were on the patio, which seemed like a good idea since the weather was nice; however, the birds squawking from next door were unnerving and leaves and stuff from the trees were falling in our food.  Not worth the drive or the wait.
Excellent breakfast, fast service, friendly people. Don't miss this mom and pop place, we will be back.

Excellent breakfast, great service, neat atmosphere.  This place has the best French Toast!  Great for families.  Plenty of choices to satisfy even the picky eaters.  Good coffee, too. Great experience.  Will be back to try the Monte Christo!
Love it.  Really good food and nice people.  Check out the courtyard.

I recently moved to AZ and wanted to try a local spot. I got on yelp and found this place and it was a pleasant surprise. Great breakfast and lunch that you can tell everything is homemade. The pancakes are awesome, the homemade jelly is equally fantastic. I also recommend the build a burger option for lunch, they have great options like chorizo. The staff is always very friendly and attentive. I had the chance to meet yoli herself and she was extremely nice and outgoing! She even sat down and talked to us and shared her story. Me and my family are now regulars, even when my parents come in from out of town this is the first place they want to go.

What a great restaurant - great, fresh, delicious food, and wonderful customer service.  I would recommend this place to everyone!  The only drawback is that it's a tiny hole in the wall...with limited indoor seating.  But the food and service make it worthwhile to visit.
Two words... Mouth watering!!! The Volcano style was AMAZING. Can't wait to make another trip to Yoli's cafe. Yummo!

This is my favorite place to go for breakfast! I always sit on the patio and bring my dog. The waitstaff is always friendly to me and my dog. My favorite thing in the menu is the green egg and ham omelette. I get their potatoes as a side and they're delicious, flavorful and homemade. My boyfriends loves to add their cheddar biscuit to his order. It is delicious!
Great home town cafe atmosphere. Patio seating is great when the weather is nice.  The best pancakes I've had in a long time.

The Corned beef Hash at this place was amazing! I gave Yoli's a 2 star rating because of the poor service I've received. The waitresses and bus boy passed by 4-5 times without asking how we were doing or asking if we needed a refill. I had to flag down a waitress for a refill and received attitude "what do you want". Once I received my drink it was slammed on the table. She also left our empty cups on the extremely small table that we had. I will NEVER come back to this place again.  FYI made this YELP account just to express my concern/annoyance about this place. Please do not waste your time here

Awesome little gem in the same plaza as The Perch. The owners will make you feel like family, and the chorizo is the best in town. They're always accommodating, especially for little ones who can be impatient with the fresh made to order dishes. Yoli has even whipped up incredible stuff for us when we tell her what we're craving. It's nice to see people who truly care about their community be successful, and we always support them!

I love this place to death because the food is great and the staff is super friendly BUT for the life of me, the food takes forever every single time we come. Even during a normal rush. I wish they can fix that because then it would be the perfect breakfast location. I just cant come here if I'm hungry because i cant wait that long any more. Please fix this Yoli because i love it here.

Stopped in by chance with my husband for lunch and it was DELICIOUS. I was pleasantly surprised because I'm a very picky eater. I had a yummy turkey blt with fries and hubby had steak sandwich, which he said was made with very good meat.  We definately plan on coming back!

The outdoor patio is really cute and very relaxing.  My boyfriend and I split a few things.  The skillet meal and bagel sandwich were great.  The french toast was ok.  The staff was nice.  We will surely go back.
Good biscuit but I like the chorizo burrito my boyfriend ordered better. It had more flavor and "kick to it". Staff was friendly and I enjoyed sitting out in the patio. Nice place to have brunch.
Hours are limited which sucks because I would def go more often. Outdoor seating area is fun and welcoming. Food is good and staff are friendly. A hidden gem!

I love the food (aside from the green eggs and ham omelette.) My only issue is the noise. The size of the place is part of the issue, but generally the employees are loud and the place just seems to encourage a very "barking" atmosphere. Very tasty, but I'd like to see them work on creating an ambience to match the food.

So... I was pretty excited about going here as it had great reviews... But I must say, I was a little disappointed by the food and the service.  Two of us went, and although it was a Saturday, we were seated pretty quickly. We both ordered hot chocolate, which was regular. Nothing fancy about it.   A little bit later, the server took our food order, and we got the veggie breakfast skillet, and a side of French toast. The French toast was pretty good, but the skillet was seriously lacking flavor. It definitely tasted fresh, but lacked all types of seasoning.   We ordered a sandwich to go as well, and it too was pretty regular. For the seasonings alone, the place lost a star in my opinion. The reason why it lost another star was because the food took FOREVER to come out. I'm talking like 35-40+ minutes on the first group of meals, and maybe 25+ for the egg and cheese on a bagel. It bothered me too that the waitress didn't check on is, or even stop by just to let us know our food was taking longer than expected.  I got 10% off discount that I forgot to use at checkout, but I don't see myself going back to cash in on it. Too bad because the place really has tremendous potential, and  I love mom and pop places like this one.
My wonderful "foodie" friend took me here for breakfast.  All I can say is, after having the steak breakfast burrito, I'll never set foot in an I-Hop or Denny's again....
This place is awesome! Great breakfast and great service. Little place that's slightly hidden, but a great little spot for breakfast.

I give this business 0/5 stars. ( I had to put 1/5 to post this review) I went there this past weekend to have breakfast with my daughter. When I walked in the lady had told me 20-25mins for a table, I was fine with that. She then processed to help the guests behind me and had quoted them 15-20 mins and there where more people in their party. I was a bit confused, never the less I still waited. I then noticed that she seated a party of 2 people that had just walked in and didn't even put their name on the waiting list. I also saw that she sat the party that walked in after me first. She also sat another party of 2 people that just walked in and never waited. When I went to ask about my spot on this list, she walks away and acts busy for a few mins. Then ignores me and helps another couple standing at the counter. When she does help me she says, Oh your next I'm just waited for someone to clean the table. Now I understand this place is small and very busy. But this is the worst customer service I have ever gotten anywhere. I have worked in the hospitality industry for a long time and have seen so many different things, but I must say this has been by far the worst. I didn't end up staying and I  won't be going back!!
Very good breakfast. Staff was very friendly. Sausage gravy is worth having your cardiologist on speed dial. :)
Great food and the service is always fast and friendly.. The skillets are great, but I love the green eggs n ham omelet.

Food was good. I had the cheddar biscuits and gravy and scrambled eggs. I was skeptical about a cheddar biscuit with gravy, but it was SO GOOD.  I went through the week and it wasn't busy at all, but I hear the weekends are very busy. My only complaint was a weird urine smell coming from The Perch, which sits next door to Yoli's. Will definitely return.
Pancakes and french toast are a delight. The natural ambiance around the trees and birds reminds us of a resort we had been to earlier.

We found Yoli's Cafe searching for locally owned breakfast joints in Chandler and based on the reviews we decided to try it. We went on Sunday around 11am. The Cafe looks like an old house that was converted into a small restaurant and there is a garden growing in the courtyard. The place is small, clean, and cute   We were able to be seated immediately but we ended up waiting an hour for our food. This normally might seem like a con, but once you get the food on a busy Sunday morning you know exactly why. It is fresh, hot, and delicious!   Best breakfast I have had out in a very long time. I had the Garden Skillet with Country Potatoes & cinnamon raisin toast. My boyfriend had the Chorizo buritto.  The skillet had fresh veggies, fluffy eggs, and fresh country potatoes. It was YUMMY! The cinnamon raisin toast was so good! My boyfriend stole a piece because it was that tasty. His chorizo burrito had hash browns in it and he said it was amazing, one of  best he has had. We also had Mexican cokes in the bottle. Yea real sugar!   My only criticism was that I wished we would have known how long it would take to get our food, an update at 45 mins or so I think would have helped. Once the food did come though, I forgot about any impatience! Our waitress said Sunday is there busiest day.   The price was fair. Breakfast for two was $20. We will be back repeatedly.

Ok, we came here for a late lunch. Definitely need to try the b-fast instead. We had the pulled pork & the shroom burger. The pulled pork is one thing that she's known for. The flavor of it is great, but the pork itself wasn't as tender as I would have liked. I love the kick in it though. They usually serve it on a roll, but the day we had it we had it on a bun. That was dee-lish. The bread was sweet and light. Me likes :)   The shroom burger was favored by both of us. Try it! I appreciate that the server double checked with us and made sure that we knew that the shroom burger was actually just a portobello mushroom and not a hamburger w/shrooms. We knew, but I thought it was a kind gesture.   I'm determined to come back and try the breakfasts though! If it wasn't for that, I'm not sure I love it enough to come more often.
The breakfast was scrumptious.  I had them add green chiles to my skillet. If you want a hearty and delicious breakfast this is the place. Will definitely come back to try their lunch menu.

The place has a pretty neat "hole in the wall" vibe which is nice, however my experience with the food wasn't all that awesome.  I got their "famous" homemade cheddar biscuits, volcano style with chorizo and eggs. The taste was ok, but the texture was way off. The biscuits were really dense, not fluffy like you'd expect. The chorizo was super greasy and had the look and texture of Taco Bell meat. And the eggs, I got over medium, we're not cooked properly (though I get sometimes over medium is subjective) My wife got the chorizo omelette, again swimming in grease.  I'll say this though, the portions are big for the price. It's definitely affordable, just not that tasty imho.
Closed until the 14th of July and nothing was posted until we drove all the way out there! Neighborhood looks a bit shady and I would definitely not come here at night!
The skillets are amazing!  Breakfasts are my favorite and this is one of my favorite places for that.  Yoli's is actually run by Yoli.
Great service and even better food! Perfect day to sit on the patio. The carne Asada burrito was one of the best breakfast burritos we have ever had! Local spot!! We love that!

I used to love this place and took all my friends and out of town visitors, but the service has gotten so poor i won't go there anymore. They've also made the portions smaller and are Nickle and diming everything. Last time I was there I was charged for the creamer on the table because I asked for more--it's too bad. Won't go there again and will not recommend this place to anyone unless you're have all the time in the world and don't care how much they charge you extra.

Today (10/13/12) was my very first experience of Yoli's. I would like to start by making it clear that the food was delicious, the servers were fantastic and the atmosphere was quaint and comfortable. I was geared up to provide a 4 or 5 star rating. The only disappointment of the experience was the wait for my breakfast. I waited an hour from the time I ordered to the time I finally got my meal. I appreciated our server - she was so nice. She apologized and checked on us regularly. Unfortunately, that time period is just unacceptable to me, especially for breakfast. I'll try Yoli's again for all of the other "pros". Hopefully, I won't have the same experience.
This place is by far the best breakfast place in chandler!! Food and service was amazing. Will be our new bfast place!
Great breakfast place.  Cozy, and fresh food!  Went there last week and it was great!

First time here and everything was amazing. What a wonderful little gem we found in this place. Looks like not much out front but it's very charming and original in back. Beautiful patio and food was fabulous. Lunch today but we will be back to try more.  Breakfast looks incredible. Plus, they are Detroit Tiger fans!  Added bonus!!!

If you want really good breakfast or brunch food this is definitely a hidden gem. You would never tell driving up to the front, but this place does it right. I believe Yoli does all of the cooking so when it gets busy, be prepared to be patient. They share an awesome courtyard with another new place called the Perch Brewery and they have a bunch of rescued exotic birds. Our daughters love to come to this place just to see the birds, but the real reason we keep going back is the food. The service is good as well, but don't forget you may have to wait for a table and then be patient for your food...it is well worth the wait!
Such a fun, small, house-turned-restaurant hidden in downtown Chandler. Great food. Good service. Not too many tables, though, so there is always a wait. I'll definitely be going back!

We were in the area and decided to stop for breakfast because of the reviews.  So glad we did. We were immediately welcomed and seated. The server was delightful and we told her it was our first visit. She took the time to go through the most popular dishes. We went with the Morning Monte and the Corned Beef Hash.  Delicious!  We will definitely go back next time we're in the area!

We love this place and Yoli. Yoli came and sat with us while we ate. Her food is amazing! It has been our go to for over a year. Great little hidden gem in downtown Chandler. Highly recommend this place! Our kids love Yoli and always want her to come with us when we leave. Haha

I love this place, the food is great and the ladies that work there and own it I assume, are so nice and friendly they make you feel right at home. It has now become one of my regular stops. Support your local cafes and quit going to the chains of restaurants.
Great place to start your day with family or with friends for breakfast/brunch. Great service and super you may food!!!  Love the atmosphere!!!
Awesome hidden gem! New favorite breakfast place! Food and service is exceptional! Recommend the cheddar biscuits and gravy volcano style and vanilla iced coffee!!!

Awesome, awesome, awesome. Did I say awesome? My family and I love this place, we always bring out-of-towners that visit here and they love it too. The friendliest staff EVER and the owner is very down to earth and outgoing as well. I highly recommend this place.

I've been to Yoli's several times and had a great experience during those visits.  Today on Memorial Day, I went to have breakfast there and you could tell their waitering staff was undermanned.  I had the corned beef hash and eggs over medium with a coffee.  My cup went empty a couple of times and I had to wait for a while each time to get refilled.  I understood since they seemed understaffed.  When I got my breakfast I first noticed that there really wasn't much corned beef in the corned beef hash, but mostly potatoes.  It was salty and the food had an egg stink to it.  I tried the eggs and they were undercooked and had a funny smell to it as well.  I pushed the plate away from me and closer to the edge of the table to indicate there was something wrong.  One of the girls running the pay counter brought us our bill about 2 minutes after we got our food.  She saw that my plate was full and pushed to the edge but just walked off.    My waitress comes by much later into the dining experience and asks as if irritated, "What's wrong with it?"  I thought she might even take a bite of it herself and shove back at me saying "tastes fine to me!"  She took the plate away in disgust and didn't even ask if I'd like it remade or another item.  The same girl who dropped off the first bill came by just as impersonally as before and dropped off the check with my food order removed, but no comp for my coffee."  I went up to the cashier to save time and it's the girl who dropped off the check.  She has the nerve to ask me, "Did you enjoy your meal?"  Really?!!!?!  I told her bluntly, "No, I did not."  I don't know what happened to this place, but my previous experiences here were very friendly and just what you'd expect from a mom and pop establishment.  I'm disappointed and don't feel comfortable bringing my family here again.

For the price this place is great! Ordered the breakfast burrito and it was an equal portion of eggs, potatoes, and veggies. It was also a LARGE burrito so you can easily split it with someone if you're looking for something light. Not necessarily a unique burrito but it hit the spot.

You'll wait a while on a Saturday or Sunday morning, but it's worth it! I suggest The Breakfast Monte sandwich-- with egg whites, bacon, turkey, and cheese pressed between two pieces of french toast! Amazing! Service is a bit slow, but it's such a relaxed atmosphere at this place, it really didn't bother us much at all.

I find the apology from the owner, a little different than the e-mail he actually sent me on march 5th. I'll let you decide... Hi Teddy,  rick s. has sent you a message on Yelp:  Your Review  "Teddy I do appreciate your feedback, however there are 3 sides to every story yours, ours, and the truth..Yoli explained the situation to me as it escalated after she came out to talk to you and your friend.. I do agree that our server was inappropriate with the comment she made referring to you and your friend being Loud and Making a Scene in Public, nothing to do with being gay, how would she even know? Yoli says that your friend repeatedly told her you waited 10 mins not 15..Maybe the wait was to long for your taste since you were really hungry. It was a beautiful morning and enjoying the patio and the beautiful garden it what people do. Possibly taking the other tables order was an oversight, You stated that since you waited to long you were going to leave and not pay your bill for the coffee, that Teddy is theft and you would never do that if you where in a store and the line was too long so you just walk out with a drink, right? The server more than wanted to accommodate you after you made a fuss, including my wife. Regardless if there were 3 tables or 30 tables full, learn to have patience. Yoli was busy in the kitchen helping make 2 large to-go orders, many things you don't know happen in a restaurant. We both have Family and Friends that are part of the LGBT community and we nor our employees would ever discriminate against anyone. The whole new level of 2nd class citizen was really Amplified by your friend calling my wife a Wetback which you failed to mention in your review. He should be ashamed of his actions. We care about and even love our customers which you could still be, as we invite you and your friend back for breakfast or lunch and we both can make some apologies and have a better day. Please respond when you have had time to read this and maybe cool off. Thanks Rick and Yoli"
One of the best breakfast meals I have ever had.  If you are in the area, hit this one up.  I will go back every time. Rock on!

First let me say that this place is hidden yet, very popular amongst the locals; there was plenty of street parking upon arrival but, close to nothing once we left. The venue is reminiscent of a small house that one's grandmother or great-grandmother may have owned. We arrived around 10:20 am and was advised of a 20-30 min wait; more like 45 to an hr. For that I give them 4 stars as they are a but unorganized.  A new restaurant (The Perch) opened a few weeks ago and they share a courtyard with Yoli's which, could be both good and bad. Yoli's is quite small and it appears that the property lines for both restaurants is very awkward; there are a few tables for The Perch that are right next to and surrounding tables for Yoli's Cafe. This might be ok PRIOR to The Perch opening at 11 am but, anytime near that, they have no problem kicking you out. Both restaurants should work together to work this out as it could potentially cause customer service issues.  The food was reasonably priced, I'd return.

Order the Mornin Monte and you won't be disappointed.   Took some family that was in town for Spring Training here on a Friday morning. The staff was extremely friendly and there was no wait for an outdoor table.   Everyone really enjoyed their food. I ordered the Mornin Monte which was amazing. Probably the best breakfast sandwich I have ever had. The Spicy Marmalade is what really took it to the next level for me. It was so good.

Local, Fresh and Friendly. More like walking into your own dining room. Except no pots and pans to clean up afterwards.  Locally sourced foods and prepared with with loving care. The waitress is always friendly and helpful in what to order. Small menu but enough variety to come back every week and not be bored by the selections. Owner is around and checking on the food. SUPPORT YOUR LOCAL MOM AND POP RESTAURANT ! Go and have a good Breakfast or Lunch. You will not be disappointed !

So here I am sans family and not a clue where to go and what to eat, so like the rest of us: HELP YELP!!??  Found this hidden gem in Chandler and definitely would recommend it!  The staff is friendly, helpful, and ready to work!
This place was fantastic!! I highly recommend the Mornin Monte! The atmosphere is relaxed and inviting and our server Sherry was wonderful! I'll definitely be a repeat customer!

This is my best breakfast restaurant in chandler! I do the scrambled egg whites(they charge extra for egg whites), wheat toast, country potatoes, and French toast for less than 10$ can't compete with that!
Horrible service, loud & crummy ambience & mediocre food. It took 1 1/2 hours to get get an order of french toast, not worth it!

Went to Yoli's for a late breakfast with some friends last weekend. We wanted to go eat someplace that wasn't the usual Denny's/Ihop/Good Egg. This place was a nice change. It's a quaint hole in the wall joint on a little side street in downtown Chandler.   I had the Monte which was a great breakfast sandwich of ham, Havarti cheese and an egg (I had mine scrambled) between Hawaiian milk bread French toast and lightly dusted with powdered sugar. They give you this spicy marmalade on the side and when you spread it on the sandwich, it gives it a nice flavor. Really tasty, definitely recommend.  My friends had the chorizo skillet that had country potatoes, an egg, cheese and chorizo. They serve pico on the side along with tortillas. They really enjoyed it. Good food, easy on the bank!

Call ahead to reserve a table as weekends can be super packed. Yoli's is dog friendly so you'll find us here with our pup enjoying breakfast on the patio. Try one of the skillets or omlettes...huge portion size and enough to share. If you have a sweet tooth, be sure to try the Hawaiian French toast....delicious!!

First time in Arizona, and Yoli's received a high recommendation. Boy did it come through!  We went there on our first day in town, and loved it so much we went back three times!  Ordered the Veggie Omelette with home fries and corn tortillas. The veggies are grilled to perfection and stuffed inside a huge pocket of fresh eggs. Eggs were cooked perfectly each time, and I'm a stickler for over-cooked(burnt) eggs in omelettes. The avocado on top was the perfect west-coast addition for me.   Home fries were grilled perfect and not burnt.   And to top it all, take a fork full of omelette and home fries and pile it into a fresh corn tortilla. I'm drooling thinking about it.   Plus, when you come from freezing cold winters in Ohio, eating a casual breakfast outside is just what the doctor orders to cure the winter blues.  We came during the weekday, so we were not in a rush for anything. Since the place is small, I could see it getting pretty packed on the weekends. well worth the wait!  I will be visiting Arizona again next month, and can't wait to make it back to Yolis!!!!!!!

Great place for a breakfast sandwich. Stumbled across Yolis while getting work done on my car around the corner. Friendly server and got to meet Yoli herself. Nice to see the actual owner is cooking up the great food. I'll be back.

Excellent food and great ambience! If you're in during breakfast, have the morning monte. If you want something spicy instead, try the chorizo - it's fresh and flavorful, and one of the best I've tried!

The breakfast here is really good. This is not fast food so dont come in a hurry. The french toast is crispy outside, soft inside just right. I kind of want some right now. Omletes are really tasty, get it with chorizo and you will not be dissapointed at all.
Reminds me of eating at Grandma's kitchen farm, except that it tastes more like a Denny's.  the scrambled eggs were terrible and just basic wonder bread toast.  Much better in the local vicinity.

Really enjoyed our breakfast here.  My french toast was great (not soggy), the coffee was good, everyone else enjoyed the breakfast.  Our favorite part was the little communal garden and sitting outside.  The kids had a great time walking around the garden, looking at the plants, sculptures and the birds.  Our waitress was wonderful and we appreciated the Yelp deal.    Just note my tip - from the outside, looks like a residential block, but the restaurant is in the back in the quaint courtyard.

This is by far the best restaurant in Chandler for breakfast!  The service is excellent.  The food is tasty and filling.  I love their Hawaiian French Toast.  It is the best french toast in the valley.  It's our favorite place for breakfast.

On fathers day, I had tried to find a new place to take my family to eat. I had never heard of this place, and it seems like it came out of no where! I called and got a reservation for the next hour. On our way to the cafe, I had no idea what to expect. Turns out the cafe is inside a house in a pretty shabby neighborhood. Immediately, everyone was a little hesitant. If it wasn't for all the good reviews, I'm not too confident we would've tried it out. The atmosphere is pretty cool! It's like sittin in somebody's kitchen! Their menu has many things to choose from and it's all fairly priced. My father got a skillet, and let me tell you. It was huge! My dad is a big man, and this was the first time he had to get a to go box. Their biscuits and gravy are FABULOUS! As well as the Hawaiian french toast. (made with Hawaiian sweet bread) it tastes like butterscotch! The only reason I didn't rate it 5 was due to the hour long wait for our food. It was fathers day and they seemed a little hectic. This place has potential to become something huge!

Yoli's catered our training yesterday and it was amazing. Attention to detail is an understatement. Each item even had a table tent describing what it was. Everything was taken care of from drinks (hibiscus lemonade & iced tea w/ a variety of sweeteners and fresh slides lemons) to dessert. And it was delicious! I thought the pulled pork and Hawaiian chicken salad would be the highlight, as I have had both several times at their restaurant. But I was absolutely blown away by the brownies w/ a melted carmel in eat one. Having the owners deliver, set-up and assure everything was perfect was the icing on the cake. Great experience!

I've been here only once for a midweek brunch and the biggest complaint that I have was that the service pretty bad, though the food wasn't.   We arrived at around 10 am and were seated by a young boy, maybe 12 years old. Roughly 15 minutes later, another 12ish year old boy took our drink order, which took another 10 minutes to arrive. Finally, about half an hour into our stay, the actual server (who I thought was a customer because she was sitting with a group a few tables away), comes and does that thing some places do where the server sits down at your table and chats while taking your order. That isn't something I normally mind, it's just a little irritating when you've been waiting for a half hour to order.   Things picked up from there. I had a carne asada burrito and my husband had a bagel sandwich of some kind. Both were serviceable if not particularly memorable. It's actually a very nice patio seating area so if you have to wait at least you have something to look at. Also, next door is some kind of a bird themed restaurant or bar, so all through our meal we could hear the birds loudly squawking and their keepers attempting to get the birds in their cages. Some people might not have enjoyed that part but we found it very entertaining.

The parrots are disgusting. They are noisy, dirty, and one even will curse at you. As far as Yoli's. I sat outside for 15 minutes before someone even attempted to take our order and then it was 45 minutes to get a sandwich! They blamed it on a large party being there and not even grill space. I would never go there again!
This place is definitely worth trying.  Off the beaten path, great food, staff and price, will be back when visiting AZ in the future.

My dad and brother came here last year and haven't stopped talking about it since. We had to come back during spring training! Off the beaten path, and you might not even know exactly where it is, it's so worth the searching. Located in a run down area of Chandler, don't let that turn you away!!!  The food is outstanding. I got the corned beef hash and it was great--dad and brother got veggie omelette and skillet with the country potatoes and both were great. We got an order of the Hawaiian French toast to share and it was amazing!!!  While the service was a tad slow, it's just because so many people were here enjoying it, and the owner was so nice and funny. Eating outside is the best with the bird sanctuary right next door. Highly recommend it!!!
Classic mom n pop place! Casual and slow paced! Emphasis on taking time to prepare a fresh and taste filled meal! Veggie omelet was loaded with fresh grilled veggies! Coffee hot and service friendly!

Tried this place out on a whim. I'm glad I did. The food is good and the small diner feel has the extra garden and bird sounds if you take a table on the patio. The servers are nice and the plates were served fast.   All the condiments are on the table. The menu is simple.

I really enjoyed the food here. The restaurant is small and the tables inside are fairly close to each other, so it's a little claustrophobic feeling. On my second visit, I sat outside which didn't feel so cramped.

I've never had such a mouth watering craving for food like I do for Yoli's breakfast. This place is my #1 favorite place to eat in Phoenix. You get great food in a friendly unpretentious atmosphere. The food is absolutely amazing. And the prices are very good. For a wonderful meal in a great environment definitely visit Yoli's. Try the morning monte You'll love it.

Yes! They are open again! Parking sucks as the next door lot is now fenced off but I love the check-in discount they give and the food is great! Service is super friendly, very accommodating with my little toddler too! Great little gem.

I had the Morning Monte which was delicious. I never would of found out about this place without Yelp. It's in a residential area off the main road. Don't let that fool you though, the food was good and staff was friendly. The outside area was nice and they even had a macaw!

Met a friend for Sunday brunch and sat at a table outside.  The atmosphere was outstanding, quiet and peaceful.  I had the sausage and cheese omelet that came with a biscuit and hash browns, all smothered with white gravy.  All I can say is, "Incredibly delicious!"   Yoli herself waited on us and was wonderful.  No waiting to be seated, served or for coffee refills.  One of the best dining experiences I've had in a very long time.  We are new customers for life.  What a find, thanks to yelp.
Anytime, I'm in Downtown Chandler in the morning, I must stop by Yoli's Cafe for breakfast.  This place just does it right, never had a bad meal or bad service.  Keep making that great food!

We had been talking about coming here ever since we read about them winning the the taste of Chandler this year. Finally, last Sunday we decided to go in for breakfast, but by the time we got there, it was 1:30.  Very cute place and very clean. They have a great menu and we ordered lunch, although on Sunday they serve breakfast until they close. I had the Monte Cristo and my wife had the tuna melt. My wife said her tuna melt was delicious, perfectly cooked and very tasty with seasoned fries. My Monte Cristo was made with Hawaiian french toast and served with a spicy marmalade. Both were fantastic. They even brought out a taste of their award winning pulled pork for us, and after trying it, we clearly understood why they won.  The best part was the staff, who were all very friendly and took the time to talk to us and make us feel at home.  Yoli came out to see how our food was, and sat down with us and we talked for quite some time.  She is a great cook and a really nice person.  Please go there and give them business - let's help keep the small places going strong in Chandler - this place is worth it!

What a difference a day can make!  Yesterday my wife and her friends stopped at Yoli's for breakfast on the way to the Gem Stone Show in Tucson. When she came home and she said we have to go back, that she really had enjoyed her breakfast.  So this morning I agreed to give it a try.  I'm a big fan of locally owned joints and always try to support those verses chain restaurants.   Yoli's is off on a little side street in downtown Chandler.  It's in a converted little bungalow that features some other little shops in a common courtyard.  When we walked in, 9:30ish, there were some tables available and a waitress walked by and told us to sit wherever we wanted.  Around the same time several other couples came in and seated themselves.  Customers around us seemed to be enjoying their meals and from what I could see they looked good.  We continued to see wait staff running around but nobody was acknowledging us, they could have said' "sorry, we'll be with you in a moment".  Now my wife is getting perturbed, I'm normally the one that says I'm outta here after 10 minutes but today for some reason I was being the voice of reason. Finally after 18 minutes the same waitress comes by and asked if we have looked a menu yet, we didn't have any yet, we have no beverages or silverware - nothing!  She comes back with 1 and says that they don't have any extra menus and could we share this one.  Still hasn't asked us if we would care to have anything to drink.  After she finished serving the table next to us she then asks if we would like anything to drink, finally!  She comes back with our coffee and waters and she takes our order.  When my wife inquires about the potato choice we are told that they are out of the country potatoes today.  Its mid-morning and you are running out of potatoes already?  Ok, so we get our ordered placed and start to enjoy our coffee.  In the mean time I'm noticing 2 couples sitting outside and they have been waiting at least 15 minutes and no one is acknowledging them, you can see them looking around to see if they can flag down help.  When they finally wait on them we notice that they are getting their coffee in paper cups.  Then we hear another waitress tell the four top next to us that they have run out of coffee cups and hope they don't mind the paper ones.  My wife says they never had to wait the day before, which they had great service and the food was out in descent time.  Not so today.  It's now been 40 minutes since we placed our order, the waitress comes out to the table next to use to ask who ordered the Steak & Peppers Skillet, they reply that isn't our order, the waitress turns and looks at us (mind you now, she took our order) and says I wonder who ordered this.  I said that I also ordered the Steak & Pepper Skillet and she says they wrote the wrong table number on the slip.  (It was you honey) She then hands me a menu and ask if I would like to order something else, that they are out of Carne Asada for that meal.  This tells me that the cooks aren't checking what is being ordered until they are preparing that meal or the waitress is not in tune with the kitchen.  Either way that was the final straw for me.  We left and I'm disappointed for them.  You have to take care of your customers in a timely manner.  I could have over looked running out of some of the ingredients but not 40 minutes after you have taken my order.  Someday, if you last, I will try you again.  Good luck Yoli's!

I can't believe this restaurant has been hiding here all this time and I never knew!  Tucked into a residential neighborhood in Chandler, right behind The Birdcage ... Yoli's is a gem!  Sit in the back patio if ambiance is important to you, as the inside leaves much to be desired in the way of aesthetics. The food was fabulous. I was disappointed at first that they do not have eggs Benedict on the menu. That being said, my sweet and speedy server was right in stating that there were many other delicious options from which to choose. I had a veggie omelette and my dining companion had the Denver omelette with home fries and fruit on the side. The omelettes were light and fluffy with lots of fresh ingredients. The coffee is fabulous ... a must for any breakfast joint. Next time you're near downtown Chandler, consider this little eatery and support local business!

We decided to give this place a try. We used door dash delivery service. Unfortunately the small menu they offer on there is not what they actually offered.  They didn't have the kids menu items so a chorizo burrito was suggested as the only other option as they didn't have a ham and egg burrito as their menu stated they did. The pancakes were huge. Hawaiian french toast wasn't bad, muffin and fruit were average. The food was average overall,may have been better if we went to the actual location, but I think we will pass on that for now. Maybe they will update their menu on there so others can have a better experience.

Man, I love this place! The food is awesome and the service is top notch! I usually get the Mornin' Monte, but on Saturday I tried the chorizo burrito and my husband ordered a bagel sandwich which were both so very tasty. We love coming here because the food is so damn good, the ambiance can't be beat and everyone is so friendly. They even remember us and that makes me feel so special :)

After reading the reviews, a group of friends and I headed to Yolis Cafe. We where greeted by a very friendly wait person who quickly fixed up a table for the eight of us. Our wait person was very friendly, and very attentive. We were all very happy with our breakfast items, which we chose from a large selection of offerings. The manager stopped by to make sure we were all happy and satisfied.  It was a beautiful day and we sat outside without ever going inside, but I looked in the window as we left, and it was very small inside. It might be hard to get a seat inside on a cold or rainy day, but some of the tables were cove
great food ,we used to go all the time  the last time we went the place was closed. thought they went out of business!!!! glade to see that they are still open!! thanks

Good pancakes and hash browns - with a generous portion size on the hash browns. Also enjoyed the Monte Cristo. Good service from the chef's husband. Another nice touch was the fruit water - tasted like cantaloupe, very refreshing.

Patience required! The service and apparently the kitchen moves at an extremely slow pace.  It took about 20 min to be seated, which was completely fine, but took an hour plus some minutes to get our food!! Once the food arrived it wasn't bad, but nothing spectacular. The service was maybe slightly less than okay.

Had breakfast today at Yoli's. The place was nice. Since it was our first time here, the staff who served us was so accommodating. She explained all the meals in the menu and gave us a very good recommendation as to what is the favorites. I ended up ordering Mornin Monte.. It was delicious. The chili infused marmalade is sooo good too. I will definitely come back and bring friends here..
Excellent food and ambience. The service was good and the garden with all the birds is wonderful. It was nice finding this hidden gem in Chandler! We will definitely be back soon.

"You can't rush perfection."-Said a really, really smart guy somewhere.   As someone who travels relentlessly across the globe, trying both national chains and local gems alike, I must say that Yoli's Cafe is the one place that I love coming back to. However, I won't write about their "Morning Monte" for two key reasons: 1. Everyone else has. Read their reviews. 2. I've never had it. (Although next time I go in I'll have to try it!)  Around two years ago, my dad and I were looking for a new place to eat breakfast. We'd looked everywhere from Scottsdale to Tempe, Phoenix to Glendale, and while we found a few good places and met some nice people, we still were unable to find that one amazing place. Our search ended when we took a look into our backyard: Downtown Chandler. There, we found a cozy little cafe owned by quite possibly the nicest, most talented cooks that this world has ever known.  Once we were seated, the first thing we noticed was the huge amounts of variety that their menu offered. Their breakfast combo allowed us to mix and match a variety of breakfast favorites like bacon, french toast, eggs, pancakes, and around ten other choices, while their portion sizes were enough to feed even the hungriest of people. Eventually, we settled on trying a little bit of everything via breakfast combo.  After about a 15-20 minute wait that was filled with extremely fun small-talk with our waitress, we received some of the best food that I have ever had. I would go so far as to say that I was PRIVILEGED to try these amazing cooks' food. Most notably, however, were their biscuits and gravy. The biscuits are far from ordinary, plain, boring bread shaped into round masses of blah. No, they are flavorful, fluffy, and fantastic, owing in part to the fact that they're cheddar biscuits (and yes, they are better than Red Lobster's). Finally, they are usually put on the grill (they're cut in half) for a moment to lightly toast and have butter melted on them. Kudos to Yoli, to whom these biscuits owe their name, for creating these little pieces of heaven. The gravy was nice, not too much sausage, but not lacking either, and perfectly seasoned.  When the two were paired though, well, let's just say it was like a symphony of deliciousness.   I realize that some people just don't like the old southern classic, but at Yoli's they can still find something phenomenal to savor. Their french toast is to die for, while their veggie burrito is my vegetarian grandma's favorite. A word of advice, though, do NOT order the pancakes if you aren't ready to a) stop eating McDonald's breakfast forever b) eat lots and lots of awesomeness (they're VERY big)  After two years of visiting this haven of culinary delights, I offer three hints of advice to those who wish to try Yoli's: 1) LISTEN TO THE WARNINGS ABOUT PEAK TIMES! Every breakfast place is bound to be crowded at the so-called "peak-time" of the morning. Yoli's is no exception. They may be culinary wizards, but they don't have time machines. If you want to be stubborn/don't mind waiting, be their guest and wait for a table. However, do NOT be rude to the staff just because YOU had the inability to realize that more people means a longer wait.  2) Don't be afraid to talk to the staff. They're extremely nice and will offer honest opinions on the food. Also, chatting with them helps time fly. 3) They have big food. Good big food, but still, big food.    I look forward to my next visit to this amazing cafe, and urge anyone who likes to eat good food to try out Yoli's Cafe.

Some of these 1 and 2 star reviewers need to go eat at Denny's more often if all they want is a cattle trough feeding experience. You had to wait for a table?  Well no kidding.  When the place has 9 or 10 tables, there might indeed be a wait.    Some of us like a leisurely weekend breakfast or brunch at a small, family owned cafe and we don't mind the wait.     The facts are that Yoli's has very good food that is delivered with a smile by a staff that feels more like family than strangers if you bother to step into the place more than once.    Prices are very reasonable for everything on the menu.  The cheddar biscuits are amazingly good.  Breakfast skillets, omelettes, pancakes, etc. are all delicious and the portions are very generous.     The wait for food has never seemed excessive to me after eating here at least 15 times.  Wait times seem appropriate given a small kitchen and small kitchen staff and everything on the menu being made to order.

I visited Yoli's two weeks ago for a breakfast business meeting.  It was a great experience.  The staff were personable and polite.  Our waitress told us about the area and was very patient when our guest was late.  Bringing coffee regularly, but not interrupting.  The food was excellent.  It was so nice to find a non-chain restaurant in the Chandler area with great food at a price I can afford to go to when work isn't buying. :-)  I highly recommend them.

This place is seriously awesome. My boyfriend and i have been staying down the street for a wedding so we tried the food for the first time on friday. The prices are super fair and the quantities are huge! We haven't had time to dine in and enjoy but we got take out and ate on our hotel room balcony. We have eaten at Yoli's three days in a row now!!! Breakfast and lunch! There was nothing we didn't love. If your in this area you gotta try it. WARNING...place is addicting so you won't just order one time, we didn't even consider giving another place a try
Best breakfast in Chandler!  Right behind Gangplank, on the south side of The Perch.  All cool spots that make me want to live on that block.

Since "discovering" this place a couple months ago on yelp, my wife and I have been several times by ourselves and with family or friends. Everyone raved about their meal and the quaint atmosphere, it's not high end or pretencious, but it's clean and bright with good service. Some of the servers and staff look a little "earth muffiny" with tats and casual clothes, but they're very friendly and attentive. It reminds me of having breakfast at my grandmother's farmhouse when I was a kid-- very comforting and down to earth, but with healthier choices. :) The prices are very reasonable and their lunch menu is more diverse than I expected. The Monte Cristo is my favorite, with Bs&Gs (biscuits and gravy) a close second. There is indoor and outdoor seating. I highly recommend this place.

My wife and I are new to the Chandler area and have been trying many of the local restaurants.  This is the best breakfast spot. Everything we ordered was good & great service as well. Very reasonable prices.
My wife and me love the food. We would definitely recommend this place. The owners are very present and greet is on every visit.

I would have never found this place had it not been for yelp. It definitely is hidden but very cute. The husband had the chorizo burrito and I had the carne asada burrito. Both were great! I want to return for the morning monte cristo... Looks delicious! Prices are more than fair and this place is a great alternative to the chain breakfast places. Give it a try and support local businesses!!!!
Don't let the location fool you! My girlfriend and I weren't sure it it was a real restaurant or not. What a diamond in the rough though! Get a smoothie and try everything you can!

If you have taste buds and you want to reward them with a little bit of pure joy then you need to do the following:  Put down your phone Put pants on Find car keys Drive to Yolis Park car Order ANYTHING Tell your mouth "you're welcome"

Had breakfast with my daughter and we really enjoyed Yolis.  It is a diamond in the rough.  Never would have found or just gone in if it weren't for the great reviews on Yelp.  I had veggie omelet and it was delicious!   My daughter had the biscuits and gravy and she loved it.  It was different than others she has had.   The homefries were excellent and again different than most.  Prices were great.   It's just a tiny little place, which we liked.  Waitress was very nice and accommodating.  We will definitely go back.
Love this home style breakfast place !   Very friendly staff and love looking at the birds after eating.

Never will I return to this place, I have not tried their food but the customer service alone was enough to make me never want to come back.So me and my friend show up albeit on a saturday morning we go inside because there's no clear signs as to where we should sit we ask one of the servers if we can just sit anywhere she says and I quote "yes go ahead and sit anywhere there's no wait list" so we go sit at a table after sitting there for a good 5 minutes another server comes and tells us that's not assigned to yolis mind you its still in the courtyard so we ask him where we should sit he looks pretty confused at this point and starts clearing up a table for us, well then a lady comes which I assume is the owner and very rudely says you guys can't sit here those people over there have been waiting for over an hour for this table we have a waiting list inside. I told her I had asked a server inside and she told me there was no list her response exactly was and at this point she had raised her voice "well I'm telling you you cannot sit here and there is a waiting list" by this time we had had it we left and if it wasn't for a parade that was going on in the downtown area we would have gone to in pockets which we love and always get treated with respect. Very unpleasant people and very disorganized place..

First, the food is really good.  The Biscuits and Gravy with Chorizo on top...my word, its amazing.  Which is why I have 2 stars.  My girlfriend and I have been coming here consistently, to the point of us working on a deal with the owner to get some coffee from them.    This past weekend, we had family drive down from north phoenix to come enjoy our favorite breakfast spot.  There were 5 of us.  We called on the way to check on the wait, there was none, and it was "Dead".  The woman on the phone was rather rude to my girlfriend on the phone, but, we all have days.  No biggie.    We get there, and 3 tables had just been sat, and there was no room, inside, for our table of 5.  30 min wait.  We noticed two tables were close to finishing their meals and we asked if we could just pull 2 tables together (like every restaurant has done, ever...since forever).  We were rudely told NO, we can't because it would be in the isle.  Well, without drawing a diagram, it would have simply required 2 steps more to get around the table.  Not a huge deal.  Not blocking a an exit or the kitchen.   We decided to leave and find another business that would be happy to have 5 people spending $15 a piece on breakfast.  The most disappointing part of this, is that we loved this place.  LOVED it! However, we work hard for our money, and will not be giving any more of it to a business that is rude, and unaccommodating to people who want to spend money.    As a small business owner, my advice, get some descent people running your business.  I have met the owner, nice enough, but the people we interacted with were rude, and VERY unwilling to be helpful in any sort of way.  What a shame.

Yoli's Cafe is quite charming, I really love the ambiance of the surrounding square even though it is not in the best of places. I really wanted to give Yoli a 4 star and they deserve a 3.5 really. I've had only breakfast here and I had about 5 different items to really try and get that 4th star for them in my mind, but I just could not find that dish that really scream 4 or 5 star. They do things well and they try to be creative but are off the mark a little. The best is likely their French Toast with hawaiian bread is well done, but the syrup is just tad low in quality. The breakfast burrito, I was not much of a fan, seems generic nothing that stood out. The skillet is enormous and filled with great different items but the biscuit was not really a biscuit but more of a roll than a biscuit. The omelete was also decent, but a little too much cheese. Don't get me wrong, I like Yolis and I would not hesitate to recommend it to people I know but I can not say that the food is 4 star. It is what it is which is a nice little cafe with decent food.

Yolu's Cafe is a gem in downtown Chandler. Yoli and her staff are so friendly and the relaxed atmosphere makes for a great morning start. Yoli's menu is fresh and eclectic. Try her Hawaiian French Toast or Fruit and Yogurt Parfait. Yoli makes her own granola you have to try.
Awesome Monte Cristo! Staff is super friendly. Yoli's Cafe is so good that I had to make a yelp account just to write a review and recommend it. 5 stars all around.

My first time here, and I loved it. My family came with me, including my husband, 2 young sons and my mother in law. The kids played with the puzzle and coloring books making it nice for the adults to talk. The best part of our experience was being about to go outside and enjoy the garden area. Overgrown trees shade the cobblestone walk. They have cages outside filled with birds for everyone to enjoy. It was a great way to spend sunday morning. The food was huge portions, and I will be back next weekend for sure.

Amazing breakfasts! The Morning Monte was the best, don't skip on the jam.Everything that my family ordered was delicious! Wish they would put misters on the patio since it is a bit hot and limited seating indoors. Will definitely be going back and adding to our breakfast restaurant list,

Arrived at Yolis with a 6 person party...so not surprised by the long wait (although the estimated 20 minutes turn into almost an hour). Was seated, given a 3 free muffins to share while we ordered.  So with tired kids looking forward to the meal. Did not expect the meal to take 45 minutes (we did not comment, but it was explained as new kitchen staff). Then when I went to pay with a coupon that included a free meal. Yoli's proceeded to remove the cheapest meal from my check. I suggested that was incorrect, it should be the 2nd most expensive. Cashier checked...told I was wrong. (Thought about splitting the check...but instead) left my name and phone number along with a note about my displeasure ( did not wish to make a scene in front of grandkids who were more than anxious about getting with their day after a 2+ hour breakfast). This was now a month ago...never heard back. Just ok food, poor service and apparently a lack of interest in retaining customers.

Great food and even better service!!!! They were really busy for breakfast when we went so it took a little while longer than normal to get our food so our waitress brought us out a complimentary muffin to hold us over and apologized. The muffin was INCREDIBLE!!!!!! Talk about great customer service! Love this place!!!

Went this morning to this place first time looks like a hole in wall but the restaurant outside was beautiful decor and quite wish I would've waited to sit outside. I the morning Monty I think they call it it was amazing that chili marmalade is maid in house and really stands out. And that Hawaiian French toast is really good just good simple ingredients. Definitely come back.

I came here hoping to catch brunch but I guess it ends at 11:30am or 12pm. Luckily the lunch menu looked just as tasty. We ordered the Luau pulled pork sandwich (the jalapeno cole slaw gives it a nice kick) and the Monte Cristo (french toast instead of regular bread slices = delicious). Service was friendly and attentive. The dining area is decorated like a household- very comfortable and clean.

Great little place with really good food!  I had the morning monte, which is a twist on the monte cristo for breakfast.  Quite good, but I wouldn't say transcendent.  I also had the biscuits and gravy- again, excellent, but not mind-blowingly memorable.  So, not quite 5 star worthy, but very good!

This is by far one of my favorite places. I'm addicted to their egg salad sandwiches! The breakfast are large , like the biscuits and gravy. I bring people here all the time and have never had any complaints. Salads are great too.

I really love this restaurant!  I discovered it here on Yelp when I was looking for somewhere for my boyfriend and I to go for breakfast/brunch.  The first thing I like is that it's hard to find: I don't think I'd have ever found it if I wasn't looking.  Depending on if you exit through the front or back, it's like two different neighborhoods.  The second thing I like is the atmosphere.  The square the building sits in is very "quaint"... that's the best word for it.  It's a few old houses turned in to business, including a stamp shop.  There's a ton of cool landscaping happening in the middle, complete with an enclosure of birds!  Everyone is really friendly, there is awesome outside seating, and just good service.  Lastly, of course, is the food.  It's nothing extravagant, it's your usual breakfast food and combos, but it tastes like it just came out of my grandma's kitchen.  The pancakes are really good... and that says a lot because I usually won't eat pancakes.  One small touch I appreciate is that they provide flavored creamers, not just original half-and-half.  The coffee is good on its own, but I like a little flavor.    There's no doubt we'll continue to frequent this hidden gem!

If you're looking for an amazing breakfast/brunch spot that is local and privately owned, you need to come here. Excellent service and unparalleled food. Our server was so sweet, and then we had the pleasure of talking with Rick, Yolie's Husband who is probably one of the kindest people on planet Earth. There is absolutely something to be said about a hole in the wall place that exceeds every expectation. We ordered the Morning Monte sandwich and the biscuit and gravy-Volcano style. So so so so so great. We will absolutely be back. Thank you, Yolie's Cafe for making our dining experience so great.

Downtown Chandler's best kept secret! Yoli's is an awesome cafe for casual dining with great food and service. I highly recommend the breakfast skillets, they are delicious, and provide plenty of food to satisfy the heartiest of appetites. Staff is very friendly and attentive, you can't go wrong with Yoli's!

What can I say about Yoli's cafe...  ooh that rhymed!  Enough rhyming.  Would never have found this place if not for yelp and my normal Saturday ritual of typing breakfast/brunch into the search option to see where the internet is going to send me to fill me up with breakfast goodies.  When I saw a place in Downtown Chandler that was both reviewed as delicious and inexpensive, that's when my search that day ended.  Popped that address into GoogleMaps on my phone and away we go.  "In a quarter mile make a left turn," says my phone in that lovely monotone robot voice reminiscent of a test proctor in grade school.  Are you sure Google Lady?  That looks like houses...  "Make a left turn!"  Ok ok ok, I believe you.  Don't have to yell at me.  Oh dear, where are you taking me phone?  Another quick right turn and we are clearly in a neighborhood and right as I about to turn around... "Your destination is on the right."  Oh wait!  It is!  Walking through the doors, I wasn't too sure if I was walking into a restaurant or someone's house.  That's ok though because it smelt heavenly and based on the amount of people in their, this was a restaurant or the home of a really hospitable homeowner who liked to cook.  We were promptly offered a place to sit and given menus.  Phew, it is Yoli's.  I ordered a cup of coffee and an egg skillet.  And dear lord in heaven above, I swear i heard angels singing when it was being carried to my table.  Too dramatic?  I may have let out an audible, "Oh Yeah!" similar to that of the Kool-Aid guy though.  Eggs we're cooked to perfection and and coffee kept flowing.  The waitress was very kind and prompt with everything.  It is a definite family feel here at Yoli's.  Did I mention my bill was less than $15 for breakfast for both me and my girlfriend!  Give them a try down at Yoli's!  Trust me, you'll love it.

This place is awesome!  It has a great breakfast along with some great waitstaff.  If you want to go to a one of a kind breakfast place rather than some  chain this place is it.  Don't  get fooled when you drive up.  It is worth going to?  Congrats on a great place
Yes there was over an hour wait but the food was worth it ... The service was good and everything was hot and delicious when brought to the table

One of the best Yogurt and Fruit Parfait in town. Been there multiple times and always loved their Yogurt and Fruit Parfait .  Also tried other breakfast options and liked them a lot.  Love the ambiance they share - Tropical atmosphere with tropical plants ,flowers ( (hibiscus etc ) and tropical birds ( Colorful Parrots which are rescue birds ) . Feels like an Oasis in the Desert.
Excellent breskfast in low-key atmosphere. Had the mornin' monte, and my wife had the veggie burrito. Equally delicious! Our waitress was fabulous and very welcoming.

Decided on this place because of the Yelp reviews.  It wasnt disappointing at all.  It looks crazy from the outside and I had no idea the kind of place I was walking into.  But once insides, feels like a little diner or normal breakfast spot.  I ordered a steak and onion and pepper skillet.  It came with my choice of hashed browns or potatoes and i went with the hash browns.  Visually, with the fresh guacamole slices on top, it was amazing.  It looked like the best, most well put together dish I have ever seen for breakfast.  It was a little bland though.  It needs some hot sauce, and just felt like it was missing some seasoning.  But it was super fresh, and when the hot sauce was added it was outstanding.  I would come back for sure, and would like to see how some of the other items taste and look.
The steak and peppers skillet and French toast were delicious! Service was good too, coffee cup was never empty and the waiters were friendly!

A bit of a gem in the rough. Hard to find in the middle of a neighborhood, but once inside, you will be happy you did!! The atmosphere is very warm and family feeling. The muffins are clearly homemade and fabulous. The yogurt and fruit parfait has actual fresh delicious fruit and out of this world homemade granola! I had the carne asana breakfast burrito. Thumbs UP! Hubby had the biscuits and gravy volcano style with 2 over medium eggs. Almost licked the plate! We will definitely be back!

100% terrible , went there fri morning with my wife after seeing all the great things people where saying about the place they should close up .  IF. You own a restaurant and you can't give your paying customers   Your full attention since they are paying you for you supposedly great food really shut the doors and finish doing what ever it is that is so important like moving or closing I overheard the very loud bigger lady who acted like she was in charge say the restaurant was bought out but they where more interested in pushing furniture out the front door than bringing service to the back where the customers where I dropped a fork and it took 10 min to get another and the actual waitress did more time bullshitting with her " old customers " kissing them goodbye then trying to take care of the present ones and to top it off she had a real bad cough she never once washed her hands  If I remember correctly this the place that was on the news as a struggling new restaurant in the new hipster downtown chandler  bye bye I hope another beer brewery opens up instead! and the food was horrible with no taste

I wanted to love Yoli's Cafe, but our experience was less than stellar yesterday. When I arrived, I was told the wait would be 20 minutes. I wound up waiting an hour. I've never waited that long in any restaurant in Phx before.  When we finally sat down, we weren't given menus, we had to track someone down to get some.  It took a long time for our order to be taken and to actually deliver the food to the table. My friend was getting irritable and I think that's the only reason our food came faster!lol The patrons next to us got so fed up that they left. The French toast was not good and the short stack pancakes were just ok.  They were a little "doughy" for me, but my friend loved them.  Since her French toast sucked, she had to eat my pancakes to get full. Now the pièce de résistance was the cheddar biscuit breakfast sandwich. OMG! So good! Get it please! Mine had egg whites, spinach, mushroom and Havarti cheese. It was one of the bagel sandwiches, that I subbed the biscuit instead. On the positive side, our waitress was very nice and apologized several times and even provided us with a muffin to hold us over.  I understand that they were swamped possibly due to the festival going on that day, but everything really reflected poorly on their establishment.  The prices for breakfast are very affordable, so I guess that's why people flock here.  I'm definitely willing to give it another shot, especially for that biscuit sandwich. Plus I really want to support local family owned businesses.

Best skillet I have ever eaten is at this place.  the Hearty, it is no joke a perfect breakfast skillet.  The Hawaiian French toast with chile marmalade is also excellent and a very unique and excellent way to do French toast.  One of the best breakfast spots this side of the Mississippi!

My girlfriend and I went here for the very first time together this morning and it was good! She got the country style omelette which looked delicious and I got the two hot cakes which were good but nothing too special. The reason I didn't give it a 5/5 is because it was good but it wasn't anything to die about and I would like a little bit more of breakfast options on their menu.
My boyfriend and I love coming here! Great food and people. I try to come every weekend. I recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

There is a quaint little place tucked away behind Downtown Chandler. It sits on an off road you would think it was a residential place only you look further and there you Find Yoli's. This being my first visit I found it quite Charming small and out of the way but much better then some of the chain restaurants. It only serves breakfast and lunch and if they expanded I'm sure they would be quite full. I had a sausage and biscuit and my husband had the volcano sausage and biscuits which has chorizo on it. The flavor was amazing. Fresh and warm and tasty. Don't miss out on one of Chandler's better little restaurants for breakfast and lunch.

YUMM! No wonder why this place won awards! The service and food were amazing! Their prices are pretty good too. The neighborhood that its in isn't ritzy (there's a tattoo shop next door), but it's still a great little hidden gem. Unlike a lot of the chains out there, Yoli's will really appreciate your business.  (Try the Monte Crisco, it's delicious!)

Yoli's is a little hidden gem in downtown Chandler.  It's got a little patio with a lot people waiting to be sat.  Everything is made FRESH, so it takes awhile for you to get your food.  Be patient when you come here, it's worth it, but everything takes a while to get to you.  They are on Hawaii time, aka no time.    The staff is super nice and they are very attentive.  They will come around on a regular basis, let you know where you're at with your order and refill your drinks right away and they always as if you want your drinks to go before you leave!  Recommend trying:  French Toast Biscuits and Gravy Skillet  The biscuits and gravy sell out fast so I would recommend getting there early if that's your favorite dish!  PS - before you leave, pick up a cupcake... you won't regret it I promise!

What can say? Believe the hype! This mom and pop gem is truly a destination for serenity and great food. Like many others I went with the "Mornin Cristo". It was equally balanced in sweetness and savoryness. I had my egg over-easy  to make it a little more richer. The Spicy Orange Marmalade compliments it perfectly; for those who don't like a sweet and spicy kick you can also eat it with regular syrup. The coffee was smooth and velvety , I didn't even have to use sugar. The service was friendly but not overly bearing. I ate in the courtyard facing the water fountain it was so peaceful. The prices are so low and didn't feel the need to use the 10% check-in offer through Yelp. I will definitely go back here again.

Their food is comparable to Denny's but sit down setting is nicer : )  I had the steak skillet for breakfast. Was told they marinate the steak but it tasted pretty plain and I had to use ketchup (which I rarely use). Personally, it's as good Denny's skillet. But this place definitely have a nicer sit out garden environment.

Cindy said Yum n Come! We were particularly impressed with Caroline's attentiveness; she brought us a birthday muffin- freshly made lemon blueberry, for birthday boy, Jonh. Love it.  . The Hawaiian French Toast is light, airy, eggy, so gooood. Veggie burrito and veggie skillet are all good.
french toast done RIGHT! Best I ever had.  Loses a star though for appearance, not the nicest inside.   Priced well and amazing service. Again, try the French toast.
Closed for renovation. Not sure how long.  4 rating since didn't eat there and that was the average.

Cute place, pretty easy to find. The outside area is fairly small but we were able to get a table with no wait. Greeted very friendly when we went in. Good food; I had the chorizo burrito and hubby had the hearty skillet. Those plus an iced tea and an orange juice came to $17 and some change and with the 10% off for checking in, it was $15 and change not including tip. The only problem we had was the long wait times. It took awhile to give our drink order, took awhile to get them, and it took a lot longer than expected to get our food after we ordered. We'll be back though.
Great atmosphere, the staff always remembers return customers, they could not be any nicer and the food, amazing. I could eat there every day!

Love the courtyard area, except if you are looking at the house next door. Make sure you face toward The Perch so you see greenery, art, and exotic birds.  The service was ok, somewhat friendly, and slow.  The food was great, loved the Hawaiian french toast.  I would come back again.

This was a very tasty and reasonable priced little restaurant.  The atmosphere is very homey; of course, its in what used to be an old house.  When you pull up, on Oregon St., it is the back of the restaurant.  You'll have to walk on the north side through what used to be a backyard gate.  As soon as you pass through the gate you realize how charming the outdoor patio will be once all the construction is complete for the other shops/restaurants.   We got to the restaurant just a little before 9:00am and we were sat immediately.  The young lady doing the register/host duties sat us and got us our drinks.   Since everyone suggested the Mornin' Monte, we got that; we also got the cheddar biscuits & steak and pepper skillet.  As I said before, all were tasty.  The Mornin' Monte was a little sweet for me, but my wife thought it was just right.  She especially liked the special marmalade that came with it.  The steak and peppers were prepared wonderfully and the chedder biscuits were smothered in gravy.   If they don't use the patio, it is very small (maybe 10 tables).  Because of the seating situation, know that a wait is probably more the norm, for anytime after 10:00am.  Again, it was very good, we plan to come back.

My family and I ate here for the first time this morning. There were 13 of us and 7 were small children. My wife and I had gotten so used to restaurant staff treating our children as an inconvenience and even annoyance that we had forgotten what it was like to have genuine, kind, wonderful people serve us. They put us in a semi private room, put cartoons on the flat screen for the kids and the owner even came out and held my 2 year old son, who melted in her caring arms. All the staff seemed like family and treated us like family. The food came out quickly and was delicious. Portions are large and very reasonably priced. Our family has decided to make eating here a monthly tradition (we don't all get together often). This place is not fancy, it's laid back and relaxing. I highly recommend getting there early and sitting out in the garden patio, sipping a warm cup of joe and enjoying a truly pleasant experience. This place is one of chandlers best kept secrets for sure!!!
Wonderful location, wonderful food, wonderful service. My first time here will definitely not be my last! Highly recommend coming here for a cozy, cute breakfast or brunch!

I came here with my family on a Sunday morning. We arrived at about 8:50 and there were 3 tables outside. We asked if our family of four (two adults, 3 yr old and 8mo) could sit outside at a table with 3 chairs and the blonde girl behind the check in was utterly rude and gave us attitude saying "if we are ok being squished" I couldn't believe it. If it's open and available, let the customer sit down, instead of waiting for a larger table to arrive when you specifically say "we don't take reservations".  First in best dressed. The gentleman who got us our drinks apologized for the way we were treated inside and I appreciated that. We ordered our meal, my eggs that I had asked for were completely raw. I had asked for them to be poached. I bought it to the woman servers attention and she proceeded to ask me if I wanted them "poached hard" I told her "no, I just want them poached please". Mind you the egg white was still completely clear. She took them away and I waited exactly 17 minutes for them to return with the poached eggs. This time they were completely overdone. No runny yolk whatsoever. I bought it to the lovely gentlemen's attention and the server came out and interrupted us and said she would notify the back. There was never one discount or apology from the woman. This was the most appalling customer service we have ever had. I will never return here and I will notify all people I know about the horrible experience we had. Kudos to the gentleman who worked there that noticed the mistakes that had been made. He should have been the server!
This place is outstanding place for breakfast!  My wife thought it was the best French toast she has ever eaten and the biscuits and gravy are to die for!

Loved our first visit here!  Good thing we mapped the spot because it would definitely be easy to miss given it's on Oregon in a residential neighborhood just W of AZ Ave.  We were quickly seated in their outdoor patio.  The weather was fair and breezy, so it was a good option to be outside.  Patio furniture is plain and decor is sparse, but the friendliness of the staff and the anticipation of some yummy food kept us happy.  Our order did take a bit long to fill (the friendly server gave us a heads up on that before we waited too long or got frustrated), but when it came, I thoroughly enjoyed my green eggs and ham, Sam I am!  My hubby got the Morning Monte and enjoyed it but not as much as he liked the bite from my green eggs and ham (he said mine was definitely much tastier).  The meals were very filling and at 18$ for breakfast for two - I like that!!  I will definitely come again as their other omelets and burritos looked worth trying.

French toast without a smothering of syrup!  Great ambience for a lazy summer morning, we loved the touch of heat in the marmalade that came with the french toast, the cheddar biscuit sandwich was also tasty (a little salty for my taste, but I didn't order this one).  Wait staff was helpful, prompt, personable.  And because it *was* a lazy summer morning, Yoli came out and chatted as we lingered over our coffee and the younger one in our party checked out the parrots in the courtyard. Looking forward to gradually making my way through the menu.

Top tip for Chandler: stay at the historic San Marcos Resort Hotel and stroll through the charmingly renovated downtown square to Yoli's for a super friendly family breakfast.  We enjoyed the great (and quick) service and the charming mister-cooled funky courtyard complete with parrots.  Don't forget to ask for the home made chile marmalade.

Fairly average shop, really nothing special here. While the servers were friendly (albeit lax and fairly slow--they didn't take our order for about 10 minutes). The skillets were poorly seasoned, the breakfast bagel sandwiches were disappointing, and their flagship meal, the mornin Monte, was fine but felt incomplete. The chili marmalade was quite good, though.

Crap food, crap service. Not sure what the appeal is here. the place was dead we waited an hour for our food, I could have made my own eggs and bacon by that time and at 10$ a pop could have fed 20 people. One piece of bacon and runny eggs (ugh). The service was terrible too, we were outside and it was warm, our server never came by to check on us, apologize about the wait, fill our drinks etc. People with larger tables were getting their food and we had been there longer, truth be told she probably forgot about us. When she did resurface she smelled awful, like cigarettes. I love a good dive breakfast place, this is a dive but far from good.
Friendly service, the food is OK. The coffee is hot and fresh, but very weak (I like it strong). :-)
